content: RE: http://www.military.com/forums/0,15240,191775,00.html A salute to All Troops living or dead that took part in "D-Day !

title: Normandy Vets Look to One Last Remembrance

content: quote: Originally posted by LoadDrive1: RE: http://www.military.com/forums/0,15240,191775,00.html A salute to All Troops living or dead that took part in "D-Day ! Thank you for your service in the name of Freedom for all Americans to enjoy.
quote: Originally posted by LoadDrive1: RE: http://www.military.com/forums/0,15240,191775,00.html A salute to All Troops living or dead that took part in "D-Day !
reply: Thank you for your service in the name of Freedom for all Americans to enjoy.
title: Normandy Vets Look to One Last Remembrance

content: I'm 85 now and have visited Normandy five times but have not attended any 10 year celebration nor will I attend the 65th anniversary celebration this June 6th. I still hope to get back there one day and visit again all of the graves of the GIs that I knew and who are buried at the US Military Cemetery at Colleville-sur-Mer, Normandy.
reply: I'm 85 now and have visited Normandy five times but have not attended any 10 year celebration nor will I attend the 65th anniversary celebration this June 6th. I still hope to get back there one day and visit again all of the graves of the GIs that I knew and who are buried at the US Military Cemetery at Colleville-sur-Mer, Normandy.
title: Normandy Vets Look to One Last Remembrance

content: quote: Originally posted by LoadDrive1: RE: http://www.military.com/forums/0,15240,191775,00.html A salute to All Troops living or dead that took part in "D-Day ! Yes, God bless them all. The minions of enforced collectivism will never understand the freedoms for which those soldiers gave so much, some their all. That Reagan speech at Normandy 25 years ago seems like yesterday; it was so exceptional. One knew that President Reagan understood their sacrifices, truly appreciated their sacrifices and bravery.
quote: Originally posted by LoadDrive1: RE: http://www.military.com/forums/0,15240,191775,00.html A salute to All Troops living or dead that took part in "D-Day !
reply: Yes, God bless them all. The minions of enforced collectivism will never understand the freedoms for which those soldiers gave so much, some their all. That Reagan speech at Normandy 25 years ago seems like yesterday; it was so exceptional. One knew that President Reagan understood their sacrifices, truly appreciated their sacrifices and bravery.
title: Normandy Vets Look to One Last Remembrance

content: Hard to believe it has been that many years since the great invasion. God bless you all WW II Vets. I got to go to Normanday one time, it will take your breath away at the thought and the feeling of what took place there.
reply: Hard to believe it has been that many years since the great invasion. God bless you all WW II Vets. I got to go to Normanday one time, it will take your breath away at the thought and the feeling of what took place there.
title: Normandy Vets Look to One Last Remembrance

content: The cemetery at Normandy, from the pictures that I have seen, must be incredible in person... Thank you to all WW-II veterans, you gave us our today... Most Respectfully, SUNLINER81
reply: The cemetery at Normandy, from the pictures that I have seen, must be incredible in person... Thank you to all WW-II veterans, you gave us our today... Most Respectfully, SUNLINER81
